traffic lights.description: The overhead traffic light displays red, indicating that the autonomous vehicle needs to stop.
traffic lights.explanation: The status of traffic signals directly affects the decision of whether the car should stop.

traffic cones.description: A yellow and black striped traffic cone is placed in the middle of the road.
traffic cones.explanation: Traffic cones marking the roadside may indicate potential danger ahead or road construction. The vehicle should remain alert to changes in road layout or additional cone markers.

barriers.description: A median is set up in the middle of the road.
barriers.explanation: Installing barriers means delineating lanes, emphasizing that in countries where driving on the right is the norm, vehicles should keep to the right of obstacles.

general_perception.description and explanation: The traffic image shows an overhead traffic light displaying red, indicating that the autonomous vehicle needs to stop, as the status of traffic signals directly affects the decision to stop. Additionally, a yellow and black striped traffic cone is placed in the middle of the road, which may indicate potential danger ahead or road construction, suggesting the vehicle should remain alert to changes in road layout or additional cone markers. Furthermore, a median is set up in the middle of the road, delineating lanes and emphasizing that vehicles should keep to the right of obstacles in countries where driving on the right is the norm.

driving_suggestion: Continue to monitor changes in traffic lights and be prepared to respond accordingly. Stay alert for any changes around obstacles and traffic cone areas. Keep the vehicle within the marked lanes and away from obstacles. Focus on the driving task and avoid being distracted by irrelevant traffic signs. Given that road conditions are good and there are no vulnerable road users, the vehicle should travel at an appropriate speed according to road conditions and comply with general highway rules. Be ready to adjust as soon as you see any changes in road signs or traffic conditions.

1.description and explanation: A traffic signal mounted on a post adjacent to the road. This device displays colored lights (commonly red, amber/yellow, and green) to regulate traffic, instructing vehicles when to stop, prepare to proceed, or move through the intersection. The current status of the signal directly affects the driving behavior of the vehicle. For instance, if the signal is red, the vehicle is required to stop. If it is green, the vehicle may proceed if the intersection is clear. If the signal is yellow, the vehicle should prepare to stop, unless it is unsafe to do so because of proximity to the intersection.
